channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Create a new integration test IntegrationTestBigLinkedListWithChaosMonkey

The class should be able to be invoked from command line like:
bin/hbase o.a.h.h.t.IntegrationTestBigLinkedListWithChaosMonkey <rest of the IntegrationTestBigLinkedList arguments>

If I understand this correctly, when run as a unit test, this will run the test in parent as well, is that the case?

When run as unit test, it will run its own customized version.

While the command line part is inherited from parent which is wrong so I adjusted that in the v1 patch.

Thanks for the reviewing.

This message is automatically generated.

The v2 patch contains the fixes for the following two issue found when I run the new test in MiniCluster mode.

1) In file RpcServer.java, call.toString cause out of memory error and huge log file because payload of command(param) could be huge.

2) In HRegionSever.java we don't call closeWal when a server is killed(chaosMonkey does kill not abort). This is not right because LogSyncer thread won't exit even we already killed the hosting region server. The end result is causing large log files and unrelated logs because the file system of the killed region server is already closed.

This message is automatically generated.

IntegrationTestBigLinkedListWithChaosMonkey is missing a license

Is this, NUM_SLAVES_BASE, overrideable?

Will the closeWAL get stuck if problem in hdfs? Or does it just skip out?

Looks like a very nice Test Jeffrey Zhong

Did you test this with:

  • Running as a unit test
  • Running from ITDriver against (pseudo) dist cluster
  • Running from command line against (pseudo) dist cluster (you may need to call IntegrationTestingUtility.setUseDistributedCluster(conf)

+     * Short string representation without param info because param itself could huge depends on the

could be huge?

While we are at it, can you please change toShortString() to use StringBuilder? Also (call.size > 512) ? call.toShortString() : call.toString() can go inside toString().

From earlier offline discussions with Jeff, I think the problem for this IT being run as a UT was that we CM will kill the RS, but on kill, we do not close the WAL, thus LogSyncer daemon thread will just live forever and continue to output logs. The root cause of the problem is actually that we try to simulate an RS kill by calling HRS.kill() instead of abort, but since we do not quit the process, daemon threads are not killed. I agree that if we are killed, we should not try to close wal, but on the other hand, if we do not, nobody is closing the logsycner thread.

Lets also get this in for 0.94 after trunk patch is committed.

v3 patch which incorporated Stack and Enis Soztutar feedbacks.

Is this, NUM_SLAVES_BASE, overrideable?

It's a number which is only used in unit test mode. For distributed mode, it's a requirement on the min number of region servers needed to run the test.

Will the closeWAL get stuck if problem in hdfs? Or does it just skip out?

I think Enis already answered the question.

Running as a unit test
Running from ITDriver against (pseudo) dist cluster
Running from command line against (pseudo) dist cluster

I have run the test as a unit test & command line against (pseudo) dist cluster

I still kept the toShortString version instead of moving it to toString because we have some debug trace code which wants to dump the whole input payload.

Thanks for the reviewing!

+1 on patch. What you think Mr. Enis Soztutar?

I applied this then backed it out (I wanted your fixes to the rpcserver where you only log part of the rpc on exception) but I tried it and it requires that we have a cluster of 5 nodes up before it will run. Is this normal? Are other hbase-it tests like this w/ a required minimum?

It means that we will always fail hbase-it unless we are on a 5 node cluster which I do not think is what we want.
I'm pretty sure the other tests require 4 machines.
Other tests require 4 nodes. I don't know why Jeff changed it from 3 to 5 in the last patch.
Jeffrey Zhong The RpcServer should not be necessary because I think hbase-8366 should be going in soon.

Stack I think you didn't use the latest v3 patch which only requires 3 nodes for a distributed cluster(v2 patch needs 5 ) In the unit test mode, I set number of region servers to 5 because Minicluster will start them and the test can complete fast.

Could you please confirm which patch you used? Thanks.

v3. Maybe it is the way that I am doing it. I build a tgz. Start hbase. Then I do this:


$ ./bin/hbase org.apache.hadoop.hbase.IntegrationTestsDriver -r .*IntegrationTestBigLinkedListWithChaosMonkey.*

.. and then it does this:

oh. I c. I didn't try the IntegrationTestsDriver mode(thought it should be same as command line where I used 3 as min requirement).

In v4 patch, I included following changes:

1) make sure the min number of required RS is in par with other integration tests.
2) removed changes on RpcServer

Committed to 0.95 and trunk (after trying it and having it complain that it needs at least 3 nodes). Thanks Jeffrey. if you don't do it, I can make a patch to reenable distributed replay. Good on you.
